TECHNICALDETAILS.free_text: Caulobacter crescentus (strain Snc04)were induced for 1 hour at 30 degrees, labeled for 2 hours at 30 degrees (in presence of 1.8 micromolar ReAsH-EDT2); post fixed with _0.01%_ Acrolein and 2.5% of Glut. in 0.01M Sodium cacodylate buffer; subjected to high pressure freezing and freeze substitution by using Epoxy resin as fixative: 20% of the complete Araldite/Epon formulation in acetone. Infiltration and embedding in 100% of resin complex.  0.5um sections were cut and collected on gold grids. Sections were post stained with 4% of Osmium followed by Sato lead and finally 10nm was applied on both sides of sections.  Single tilt tomograms were obtained using a  JEOL 4000, and spanned -52 - 66° at 2° intervals.

IMAGEDESCRIPTION.free_text: The zero degree tilt view of the raw data acquired from an IVEM of a Caulobacter crescentus sample, strain Snc04.  This image has been downsampled from the raw data image which can be accessed using the link provided to the Cell Centered Database.
